com.adience.adboost

Class AdBoostInterstitial

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.adience.adboost.Interstitial

  • public class AdBoostInterstitial
extends Object
    Loads an interstitial ad from any of the supported ad networks. Make sure you declare the relevant activity in your AndroidManifest.xml as specified by your chosen ad network's SDK.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AdBoostInterstitial(Activity activity, AdNet adnet)
      Creates a new interstitial object with an implicit appId.
      AdBoostInterstitial(Activity activity, AdNet adnet, String appOrAdId)
      Creates a new interstitial object.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addTestDevice(String deviceId)
      Registers a device ID for testing.
      void destroy()
      Releases resources associated with the interstitial.
      AdNet getAdNet()
      Returns the ad network with which the interstitial was initialized.
      boolean isReady()
      Check whether the interstitial is ready to be displayed.

      Starts loading the interstitial asynchronously.
      void setListener(Object listener)
      Sets a listener for interstitial events as defined by the ad network's SDK.
      void show()
      Shows on screen the previously loaded interstitial.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdBoostInterstitial

        public AdBoostInterstitial(Activity activity,
                   AdNet adnet,
                   String appOrAdId)
        Creates a new interstitial object.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity that initiates the load of the interstitial ad.
        adnet - the ad network that will provide the ad.
        appOrAdId - Some networks require an application ID and others require an ad-unit/property ID - you should have it after registering and configuring your app in the ad network's web portal.

      • AdBoostInterstitial

        public AdBoostInterstitial(Activity activity,
                   AdNet adnet)
        Creates a new interstitial object with an implicit appId. This constructor should be used for ad networks that require the app ID to be defined in the manifest or that require more parameters like a developer ID.
        Parameters:
        activity - the activity that initiates the load of the interstitial ad.
        adnet - the ad network that will provide the ad.
        See Also:
        AdNet.AirPush, AdNet.RevMob, AdNet.StartApp

    • Method Detail

      • getAdNet

        public AdNet getAdNet()
        Returns the ad network with which the interstitial was initialized.
        Returns:
        the AdNet object with which the interstitial was initialized.

      • addTestDevice

        public void addTestDevice(String deviceId)
        Registers a device ID for testing. Use it for ad networks that require turning test mode on in code (others have this control in their web configuration). For ad networks that don't require a specific device ID, you may pass null or any string you wish as the argument.
        Parameters:
        deviceId - the device identifier required by the network. This field is ignored if testing mode is global for the ad network.
        See Also:
        AdNet.AdMob, AdNet.RevMob

      • setListener

        public void setListener(Object listener)
        Sets a listener for interstitial events as defined by the ad network's SDK. Some ad networks define several listener interfaces. Pass one object that implements all the interfaces you wish to implement.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener's type is defined by the ad network's SDK.

      • loadAd

        public void loadAd()
        Starts loading the interstitial asynchronously. Most ad networks display interstitials in their own activity. Make sure you declare the relevant activity in your AndroidManifest.xml as specified by your chosen ad network's SDK documentation.

      • isReady

        public boolean isReady()
        Check whether the interstitial is ready to be displayed.

        NOTE for RevMob: this functionality is unavailable and the returned value will always be true.

        Returns:
        true if the interstitial is loaded and ready to be displayed, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        loadAd()

      • show

        public void show()
        Shows on screen the previously loaded interstitial.
        See Also:
        isReady()

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Releases resources associated with the interstitial. Call this in your Activity.onDestroy() method.
        See Also:
        AdNet.MoPub
